dfischer.proxysniffer

Class BreakInnerLoopCondition

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.proxysniffer.BreakInnerLoopCondition

  • public class BreakInnerLoopCondition
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains one condition to continue or break an inner loop.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int AND_OPERATOR
      Logical "AND" operator.
      static int CONDITION_ACTION_BREAK_INNER_LOOP
      Condition action = break inner loop (jump out of inner loop)
      static int CONDITION_ACTION_CONTINUE_INNER_LOOP
      Condition action = continue inner loop (jump at start of inner loop and start next iteration)
      static int CONDITION_CONTAINS_TEXT
      Condition "contains the text fragment".
      static int CONDITION_EQUAL
      Condition = (is equal to).
      static int CONDITION_GREATER
      Condition > (is greater than).
      static int CONDITION_GREATER_OR_EQUAL
      Condition ≥ (is greater or equal than).
      static int CONDITION_LESS
      Condition < (is less than).
      static int CONDITION_LESS_OR_EQUAL
      Condition ≤ (is less or equal than).
      static int CONDITION_NOT_EQUAL
      Condition ≠ (is not equal to).
      static int CONDITION_TYPE_CHECK_HTTP_STATUS
      Condition type = check HTTP status code, value = 1.
      static int CONDITION_TYPE_CHECK_RESPONSE_CONTENT_TEXT_FRAGMENT
      Condition type = check text fragment in HTTP response content, value = 2.
      static int CONDITION_TYPE_CHECK_VAR_VALUE_AFTER_URL_CALL
      Condition type = check the value of a variable after executing an URL call
      static int CONDITION_TYPE_CHECK_VAR_VALUE_BEFORE_URL_CALL
      Condition type = check the value of a variable before executing an URL call
      static int CONDITION_TYPE_NOTYPE
      Invalid condition type, value = -1.
      static int EXEC_TYPE_AFTER_VAR_EXTRACTION
      Execute the inner loop continue or break after extracting all variables and after calling all plug-ins
      static int EXEC_TYPE_IMMEDIATELY
      Execute the inner loop continue or break immediately after URL call
      static int OR_OPERATOR
      Logical "OR" operator.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BreakInnerLoopCondition

        public BreakInnerLoopCondition()
        Object Transfer constructor.

      • BreakInnerLoopCondition

        public BreakInnerLoopCondition(long conditionId,
                       int conditionAction,
                       int execType,
                       long pageBreakDataRecordId,
                       long testDataRecordId,
                       java.lang.Integer httpStatus1,
                       java.lang.Integer httpStatus2)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Create an inner loop continue or break condition based on one or two HTTP status codes.
        Note: the parameter httpStatus1 must not be null. If two HTTP status codes are passed the calculation of is made by a logical "OR" condition between both HTTP status codes.
        Parameters:
        conditionId - unique ID of condition
        conditionAction - the action if the condition (CONDITION_ACTION_CONTINUE_INNER_LOOP or CONDITION_ACTION_BREAK_INNER_LOOP)
        execType - the execution type of the continue or break condition (EXEC_TYPE_IMMEDIATELY or EXEC_TYPE_AFTER_VAR_EXTRACTION)
        pageBreakDataRecordId - data recod ID of the page-break to which the start of the inner loop is bound.
        testDataRecordId - data record ID whose result must be tested
        httpStatus1 - HTTP status code no. 1 which continues or breaks the inner loop, or null = do not perform check
        httpStatus2 - HTTP status code no. 2 which continues or breaks the inner loop, or null = do not perform check
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • BreakInnerLoopCondition

        public BreakInnerLoopCondition(long conditionId,
                       int conditionAction,
                       int execType,
                       long pageBreakDataRecordId,
                       long testDataRecordId,
                       int responseTextOp,
                       java.lang.String responseText1,
                       java.lang.String responseText2)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Create an inner loop continue or break condition based on one or two text fragments of the received response content.
        Parameters:
        conditionId - unique ID of condition
        conditionAction - the action if the condition (CONDITION_ACTION_CONTINUE_INNER_LOOP or CONDITION_ACTION_BREAK_INNER_LOOP)
        execType - the execution type of the continue or break condition (EXEC_TYPE_IMMEDIATELY or EXEC_TYPE_AFTER_VAR_EXTRACTION)
        pageBreakDataRecordId - data recod ID of the page-break to which the start of the inner loop is bound.
        testDataRecordId - data record ID whose result must be tested
        responseTextOp - Logical condition if two valid text framents are passed (logcical OR or AND condition) - valid values are OR_OPERATOR or AND_OPERATOR.
        responseText1 - Searched text fragment no. 1 which breaks the inner loop, or null = do not perform check
        responseText2 - Searched text fragment no. 2 which breaks the inner loop, or null = do not perform check
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        OR_OPERATOR, AND_OPERATOR

      • BreakInnerLoopCondition

        public BreakInnerLoopCondition(long conditionId,
                       int conditionAction,
                       int conditionType,
                       int execType,
                       long pageBreakDataRecordId,
                       long testDataRecordId,
                       int checkVarValueCondition,
                       java.lang.String checkVarName,
                       java.lang.String checkVarValueText)
        Create an inner loop break condition based on a value of a variable
        Parameters:
        conditionId - unique ID of condition
        conditionAction - the action if the condition (CONDITION_ACTION_CONTINUE_INNER_LOOP or CONDITION_ACTION_BREAK_INNER_LOOP)
        conditionType - CONDITION_TYPE_CHECK_VAR_VALUE_BEFORE_URL_CALL or CONDITION_TYPE_CHECK_VAR_VALUE_AFTER_URL_CALL, all other condition types are not supported by this constructor.
        execType - the execution type of the continue or break condition (EXEC_TYPE_IMMEDIATELY or EXEC_TYPE_AFTER_VAR_EXTRACTION)
        pageBreakDataRecordId - data recod ID of the page-break to which the start of the inner loop is bound.
        testDataRecordId - data record ID whose result must be tested
        checkVarValueCondition - the condition that is applied to check the content of the variable against the value. Possible parameter values are CONDITION_EQUAL, CONDITION_NOT_EQUAL, CONDITION_GREATER, CONDITION_GREATER_OR_EQUAL, CONDITION_LESS, CONDITION_LESS_OR_EQUAL or CONDITION_CONTAINS_TEXT
        checkVarName - the name of the variable which value must be checked
        checkVarValueText - the value to be checked
        See Also:
        CONDITION_TYPE_CHECK_VAR_VALUE_BEFORE_URL_CALL, CONDITION_TYPE_CHECK_VAR_VALUE_AFTER_URL_CALL, CONDITION_EQUAL, CONDITION_NOT_EQUAL, CONDITION_GREATER, CONDITION_GREATER_OR_EQUAL, CONDITION_LESS, CONDITION_LESS_OR_EQUAL, CONDITION_CONTAINS_TEXT

        public static java.lang.String execTypeToString(int execType)

        Parameters:

      • getResponseTextOp

        public int getResponseTextOp()
        Return the logical condition which must be applied between the two checked text fragments of the received response content
        Returns:
        OR_OPERATOR (logical OR) or AND_OPERATOR (logical AND)
        See Also:
        OR_OPERATOR, AND_OPERATOR, CONDITION_TYPE_CHECK_RESPONSE_CONTENT_TEXT_FRAGMENT

      • responseTextOpToString

        public static java.lang.String responseTextOpToString(int responseTextOp)
        Return the string representation of the logical condition which must be applied between the two checked text fragments of the received response content.
        Parameters:
        responseTextOp - the logical condition
        Returns:
        the string representation of the logical condition: "and" or "or"
        See Also:
        OR_OPERATOR, AND_OPERATOR, CONDITION_TYPE_CHECK_RESPONSE_CONTENT_TEXT_FRAGMENT
